com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface ConnectionTestCallback<T>

Type Parameters:
T - The type of connection to test
public interface ConnectionTestCallback<T>

Allows agents to register objects to test connections. A common use case when defining credentials is to enter the new values then test them to ensure there are no typos or other errors in the credential itself.

For simple connectivity tests it is sufficient to just open and close the connection. These types of tests can be handled internally by FglAM without agent intervention. However some agents require more detailed tests. For example, the agent may require access to certain resources that are not commonly available like access to Oracle database applications or reading files owned by a certain user.

By registering ConnectionTestCallbacks with the appropriate connection service agents will be given an opportunity to execute commands using a connection that has already been opened with the test credentials. When the agent has completed its tests FglAM will close the connection and notify the FMS that the credential is acceptable.

Since:
5.5.5.1

Method Summary
 void testConnection(T connection)
          Called by FglAM when the user has requested that credentials be tested with this specific agent.
 

Method Detail

testConnection

void testConnection(T connection)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Called by FglAM when the user has requested that credentials be tested with this specific agent. Agents do not need to open their own connection because FglAM will have already done so using the test credentials. Agents should focus on testing their workflow using the connection to ensure they will be capable of executing whatever commands they require while they are collecting data.

Parameters:
connection - The connection that has been opened using the test credentials
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - The agent attempted to run the test but failed
